words.def: anything that serves as an enticement
a small piece or quantity of something
nocturnal mouselike mammal with forelimbs modified to form membranous wings and anatomical adaptations for echolocation by which they navigate
A too-low number of platelets in one's blood, especially a newborn's or fetus', due to alloimmunity.
a soft silvery metallic element of the alkali earth group
a heavy brittle diamagnetic trivalent metallic element (resembles arsenic and antimony chemically)
an agency of the United States Army responsible for providing timely and relevant and accurate and synchronized intelligence to tactical and operational and strategic level commanders
a highly unstable radioactive element (the heaviest of the halogen series)
the branch of engineering that deals with the use of computers and telecommunications to retrieve and store and transmit information
a hard grey lustrous metallic element that is highly resistant to corrosion
a light strong grey lustrous corrosion-resistant metallic element used in strong lightweight alloys (as for airplane parts)
